name: .BKP File Extension
summary: Learn about .BKP files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: BKP files are typically backup files, which contain a redundant copy of a document, database, project, or other data. Some applications automatically create BKP files at regular intervals, to back up users' data. This allows users to restore their data if the original version of the backup file goes missing or becomes corrupted.

content: Programs usually store BKP files alongside the data they're backing up or in a backup-specific directory (e.g., Backups or Backup). In most cases, BKP files have filenames similar to the files for which they are a backup. For example, a BKP file created from database.db would likely be named database.db.bkp or database.bkp.

instructions: In many cases, you can open a BKP file by:
Opening it as you would a normal version of that file.

For example, you can open database.db.bkp by changing its name to database.db and opening it as you would a DB file. (If your BKP file uses only the .bkp extension, instead rename the file to use its normal extension.)
In other cases, however, you must follow program-specific instructions to open a BKP file. In these cases, refer to your program's backup documentation.
